bug.author: sbrugman
bug.description:
This still seems to be an issue. What I've found is it may depend on which other packages you have installed. My solution was to specify the version of pandas-profiling when doing a conda install: conda install -c conda-forge pandas-profiling=2.6.0 Substitute '2.6.0' with the latest version here: <denchmark-link:https://anaconda.org/conda-forge/pandas-profiling>https://anaconda.org/conda-forge/pandas-profiling</denchmark-link>
When I didn't specify the version, it seemed to install an older version (1.4.1-0 for Linux). When I did specify the most recent version, it also downloaded qt-5.9.7 which it hadn't done before. I'm not sure what's going on, because in another conda env, I was able to simply do conda install -c conda-forge pandas-profiling and it worked, but I had installed some other packages first. If you look at the conda page (<denchmark-link:https://anaconda.org/conda-forge/pandas-profiling>https://anaconda.org/conda-forge/pandas-profiling</denchmark-link> ) it has multiple versions on there (1.4.1 and 2.6.0) for all OSs. My guess is this is what's causing the problem. Originally posted by @nateGeorge in #136 (comment)

comments.comment: Great catch <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nateGeorge>@nateGeorge</denchmark-link> ! I've opened issues at the conda feedstock. Could you provide some additional diagnostic information (e.g. Python version, conda version)?

Note I closed the issue over at conda-forge as the link there referenced the anaconda channel but if the issue still appears with -c conda-forge then something else is happening. Python and conda version as well as the conda output are needed though to understand the problem.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sbrugman>@sbrugman</denchmark-link> I installed it like and it installed the older version in one of my conda environments.
Conda version: 4.8.3 Python version: 3.7.7
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/xhochy>@xhochy</denchmark-link> What are your thoughts on where this could come from?

I'm having the same issue. Installed conda install -c conda-forge pandas-profiling but it installed 1.4. Tried to reinstall the package over 1.4 and was unable. Removed the pandas-profiling package and attempted an install of 2.8.0. No go. Any insight?
Did the explicit install of 2.8 update any other packages?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/xhochy>@xhochy</denchmark-link> Not sure what the problem was, but I...
Uninstalled pandas-profiling Updated all conda files Ran the install for 2.8.0
And I'm fine now. Thanks for the help!
thank you! It was the only thing that really solved the problem! 2h+ trying to fix
